content: We are planning a track overview and orientation at 10am ET and especially welcome cross-track collaboration with Clinical Reasoning, Care Coordination and others. See https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/2020-09+Care+Management+Track
@Russell Leftwich @Emma Jones @Gay Dolin @Sean Muir
Our Zoom meeting is now open, you'll find that meeting link within Whova within the Care Management track session.

We are planning a series of topics for discussion. The first is to review prototype work on using BPM+ process and decision models for a Hypertension use case, and the relationship of those models to FHIR data and CPG-on-FHIR (PlanDefinition and CQL).
We will start this discussion at 10 minutes, at 11:30am ET.
Ken: Are you able to share your presentation?

For anyone interested, starting at 3:15 ET today (15 min from now) I will walk through our sample FHIR R4 data resources created for our care management use cases, plus a demonstration of the Logica FHIR sandbox with support for SMART on FHIR apps and CDS Hooks in an "EHR simulator".
Mark, absolutely can share. I have a couple different versions so maybe sometime we can explore what version you think may be best
We are resuming discussion on Hypertension guidelines and CDS implementation right now. Clinical focus.
At 11:00 ET, Sean will present work on executable BPMN model for hypertension guidelines with FHIR integration.
Anyone know when and under what track today's Summary will be held?
The overall summary should be its own session, not within any individual track. I asked on Zulip, but no reply yet.
From Sandy: There will be a 30 minute wrap up at 6:00 PM for all who are interested. You can find that link in Whova under Track Highlights in the schedule.
